com.bandwidth.sqs.consumer

Class ConsumerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bandwidth.sqs.consumer.ConsumerManager

  • public class ConsumerManager
extends Object
    Manages all interactions between consumers. This includes assigning the number of allocated requests, and managing threads the process messages retrieved by the consumers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConsumerManager(int maxLoadBalancedRequests, ExecutorService threadPool, SqsAsyncIoClient sqsClient)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsumerManager

        public ConsumerManager(int maxLoadBalancedRequests,
                       ExecutorService threadPool,
                       SqsAsyncIoClient sqsClient)
        Parameters:
        maxLoadBalancedRequests - This should be the number of concurrent in-flight requests needed to fully saturate the network. Each consumer will always have at least 1 in-flight request, and additional requests up to this value will be load balanced across non-empty SQS queues. You will probably need to do performance testing to find a good value. If this is too low, you may notice low throughput for some queues. If this value is too high, you may notice connection timeouts or high memory usage. For a good starting value, 64 can saturate a 100 mbps network with small message payloads and a ~40ms round-trip latency.
        threadPool - An executor used to process consumer handlers
        sqsClient - The SqsClient used to send requests. BufferedSqsAsyncIoClient is suggested
